page.title: 09RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES
page.content: A survey of the school catchment area within the study are provided us with information. Most families owned cars, the majority having a car more than five years old. Many use bicycles for recreation. Few owned caravaning or camping equipment but some indicated they spent holidays in rented caravans. Most people holidayed in the British Isles, the majority in self catering accomodtion. A small percentage of those surveyed spent their holidays abroad. The most popular energetic hobbies were swimming and football. People also indicated enjoying squash, tennis, badminton, rugby, hockey, horse riding, judo, karate, break dancing, keep fit, aerobic dancing. Snooker and pool were popular less energetic sports. Watching television was the most popular leisure pastime.
